mainText: Some people are just Apple people. Thankfully, I can say I'm one of them. That tends to happen when the I can distinctly remember the first computer I ever saw as a child carried the logo of a rainbow colored apple with a bite taken out. Fast forward a couple of years and I'm in elementary school and so is the Macintosh. As a child it seemed like every year when I returned to school so did a newer, faster, easier to use Mac. Macintosh II was there to help me learn how to take my Accelerated Reader tests. The first Power Macintosh and it's successors allowed me to learn how to type with PAWS, find Carmen SanDiego, hook my wagon to the Oregon Trail, and explore my creativity with Kidpix.
author: Christina
